questions.question: Rahul’s composition is ……………… than that of Rohan.
questions.description: Better is the comparative form of good.

questions.question: The new mansion is …………………. than the old one.
questions.description: We make the comparative form of splendid by putting more before it.

questions.question: She is ………………. than most of her neighbors.
questions.description: We use a comparative form before than. Wealthier is the comparative form of wealthy.

questions.question: It was the ………………… day of my life.
questions.description: We use a superlative adjective after the. Saddest is the superlative form of sad.

questions.question: Gold is more precious than ……………….. metal.
questions.description: When two objects are compared with each other, the latter term of comparison must exclude the former.

questions.question: She earns as ………………… as I do.
questions.description: We use the positive adjective in the structure as…as.

questions.question: He arrived ……………….. than I expected.
questions.description: Later is the comparative form of late.

questions.question: Ours is the ………………. house on this street.
questions.description: Last can indicate position. Latest cannot express this idea.

questions.question: This is the ……………… church in India.
questions.description: Eldest is only used to speak of people.

questions.question: The princess was ………………….. than her brother.
questions.description: We make the comparative form of courageous with more.

questions.question: Mumbai is ……………… from the equator than Chennai.
questions.description: Farther means more distant. Further means additional.
